posts.title: Who Covered It Best? Wuthering Heights Editions
posts.text: With a variety of artwork gracing different covers of Emily Bronte's classic, which is your favorite?

posts.title: Bridge the Gap with BridgeUP
posts.text: Discover this innovative program for NYC teens, designed to help them succeed in high school, prepare for college, and discover their passions.

posts.title: Curiosity & Creativity After School: BridgeUP 2018 Passion Projects
posts.text: BridgeUP scholars—passionate, curious, and creative participants in an innovative after-school program—know how to take advantage of the Library's resources. As a result, they create impressive final projects, known as Passion Projects.

posts.title: Ins and Outs of British Society
posts.text: Love English literature, but don't know the difference between a barouche and a carriage? Wonder no longer!

posts.title: Hollywood's Leading Ladies: Mary Pickford
posts.text: Discover the life of the first "America's Sweetheart," a worldwide star and one of the first female innovators in Hollywood.

posts.title: Celebrate Black History Month with Our Online Exhibitions
posts.text: Check out four of the top online exhibitions highlighting African Americans in honor of Black History Month.

posts.title: 5 Films Noir Inspired by Novels
posts.text: A review of 5 mystery novels and the films noir that they inspired.

posts.title: 10 African and African American Folktales for Children
posts.text: These books blend together a rich combination of history, fable, and illustrations that engage and teach children the importance of America's cultural diversity.
